bullets.template: The US experiences moderate real GDP growth and a slight increase in unemployment to {baseline.US Unemployment.max:.1f}%
US inflation moderates, allowing the FRB to cut short-term interest rates. 10-year Treasury yield falls to {baseline.10Y Treasury.min:.1f}%

bullets.text: Equity prices are flat at 2024Q4 levels and property prices grow moderately
Real GDP growth improves to a moderate pace in the UK and Eurozone. Eurozone inflation is stable while inflation in the UK starts declines gradually in later 2025
Japan's real GDP growth will be positive, though sluggish, through the forecast horizon. Inflation in Japan fluctuates around 2% through the forecast horizon

sections.name: Severely Adverse
sections.description: A severe global recession, including prolonged declines in both residential and commercial real estate prices, which spill over into the corporate sector and affect investment sentiment, albeit to a less degree than in the 2024 severely adverse scenario.

bullets.text: US recession resembles CCAR 2024 (slightly milder real GDP shock and same unemployment rate peak)
Smaller decline in HPI reflecting lower ratio of house price to income in 2024
Smaller decline in CRE reflecting already weakened CRE sector

bullets.template: Smaller equity shock ({US Equities.shock:.0f}% vs -55%) and lower VIX peak ({VIX.extreme:.0f} vs 70)

bullets.text: Smaller downward rate shock due to lower starting point and higher trough
Yield curve is inverted in 1Q'25 and then steepens over the remainder of the scenario

bullets.template: Less severe corporate credit spread shock ({BBB Corp Spread.extreme:.1f}% vs 5.8% peak)

sections.name: Exploratory Analysis
sections.description: In addition to the standard Baseline and Severely Adverse, the FRB provided additional **exploratory analysis of risks to the banking system**, including:

bullets.text: Credit and liquidity shocks in the NBFI sector, during a severe global recession; and

A market shock featuring a sudden dislocation to financial markets resulting from expectations of reduced global economic activity and higher inflation expectations. This distress in equity markets causes the unexpected defaults of the subject bank's five largest equity hedge fund counterparties.

sections.footnote: Note the Fed states that the set of macroeconomic conditions considered in the exploratory analysis is the **same** as the set of macroeconomic conditions in the severely adverse scenario.
